quizzes.question:
Fill in the blank to define the variable string:
[!raw!]
<?php
  {0}string = "I am learning PHP";
?>
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Data Types[/h1]

Variables can store a variety of data types.
Data types supported by PHP: [b]String[/b], [b]Integer[/b], [b]Float[/b], [b]Boolean[/b], [b]Array[/b], [b]Object[/b], NULL, Resource.

[h2]PHP String[/h2]
A [b]string[/b] is a sequence of characters, like "Hello world!"
A string can be any text within a set of single or double [b]quotes[/b]. [code format="php"]<?php
[b]  $string1[/b] = "Hello world!"; //double quotes
[b]  $string2[/b] = 'Hello world!';  //single quotes
?>[/code]
[note]You can join two strings together using the dot ( .) concatenation operator.
For example: [b]echo $s1 . $s2[/b]
[b][/b][/note]

[h2]PHP Integer[/h2]
An [b]integer[/b] is a whole number (without decimals) that must fit the following criteria:
- It cannot contain commas or blanks
- It must not have a decimal point
- It can be either positive or negative[code format="php"]<?php
[b]  $int1[/b] = 42; // positive number
[b]  $int2[/b] = -42; // negative number
?>[/code]
